The British School of Guangzhou
Bulletin – Week Beginning Monday 14th April 2014
Dear Parents,
Our IGCSE and A level students are building up to their examinations and taking the opportunities offered by attending Revision programmes. We are also running 1-2-1 support initiatives, and have been for the past few months, and we intend to continue to use the remaining time left with our students to resolve any questions or doubts they may have. Please note that examination leave for Year 11 and 12 students starts from Monday, May 5th 2014.
Reports:
Students from Years 9-13 will receive their third report (Grade) of the year on Friday, 18th April 2014. Year 7 and 8 students will receive their full, written report on April 25th prior to their PTC that is scheduled for Monday, April 29th 2014.
ASAs to resume
After school activities will be resuming this week and buses will be departing at the usual time of 4pm. All students should have completed their choices and will be looking forward to the resumption of activities.
Summer Programs Talk- Years 10-13
Sean Stevens from Summer Program Cambridge Immerse will be coming in to school on Monday 14th April. The talk will be held in Mr Howe’s History room starting promptly at 12.50 and parents are welcome to attend.
“Cambridge Immerse is a two week residential educational experience that allows
participants to gain an unrivalled insight into their chosen discipline”.
It offers participants a choice of a range of subjects, from the arts to the sciences.
- Biology
- Chemistry
- Creative Writing
- Economics & Management
- Engineering
- English Literature
- Geography
- History
- International Relations
- Law
- Mathematics
- Medicine
- Philosophy
- Physics
- Computer Science
Junior and Senior Prom
We are planning on holding a prom for junior and senior students to celebrate the end of another great year at BSG. The Senior Prom (Years 10-13) will be taking place at the W hotel at the end of April and students can expect to dress to impress for the James Bond themed event.
We are also running a Junior Prom (Years 7-9) for the first time on Friday 6th June. A junior student committee is currently busy planning this event and details will follow in the next few weeks.
We would like to give our students a memorable yet affordable prom and are currently raising funds to help pay costs towards them. If you know of anyone who would be willing to sponsor both or one of these events then please contact either Miss Welch (Nicola.welch@bsg.org.cn) or Mr Ellis (Robert.ellis@bsg.org.cn) who will be happy to send through more information.
Best wishes,
Mr. Iain Ruck,
Head of Secondary
